common_issues.title: Personal domain restore issue after data migration
common_issues.description: Users are unable to change their personal domain after migrating data by copying the 'com.pieces.os' and 'com.pieces.pfd' directories to a new machine. This issue may be related to data synchronization or personal domain settings not being properly transferred during the migration process.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@laborer123) copied the `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd` directories to another PC and is unable to change their personal domain.
* User included screenshots of the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Personal domain cannot be changed after copying specific directories to another PC.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions proposed or implemented in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is ongoing and may contain further updates.
* It is unclear if the issue is specific to the user's environment or a general bug.

recommendations: **Investigate and resolve the personal domain restore issue:** This issue is the most frequent and has the highest activity level, indicating it's causing significant user frustration. Prioritize finding a solution and providing clear instructions for personal domain data migration.

**Improve data migration documentation:** The personal domain restore issue suggests that the current guidance for data migration is unclear or incomplete. Update the documentation with detailed steps on how to properly transfer personal domain settings during migration.

**Monitor new tickets and identify trending issues:** While the current dataset is limited, establish a process for regularly analyzing support tickets to identify emerging trends or recurring problems. This will allow for proactive support and potential bug fixes in the product.
